alert.note: Alert for Briscoe; Floyd; Hall; Motley (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 13 at 11:58PM CDT until July 14 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN FLOYD...NORTHWESTERN MOTLEY...SOUTHWESTERN HALL AND SOUTHEASTERN BRISCOE COUNTIES... At 1157 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles west of Quitaque, or 7 miles southwest of Caprock Canyon State Park, moving northeast at 20 mph. At 11:31 pm the South Plains West Texas Mesonet reported a gust to 73 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...West Texas Mesonet. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Caprock Canyon State Park, Quitaque, Valley Schools, Flomot and South Plains. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
